thread.title: Watch Travis Scott Walk Right Into The Enormous Hole In The Middle Of Drake’s Stage
thread.title_full: Watch Travis Scott Walk Right Into The Enormous Hole In The Middle Of Drake’s Stage

author: Bansky Gonzalez
title: Watch Travis Scott Walk Right Into The Enormous Hole In The Middle Of Drake’s Stage
text:
By all accounts, Travi$ Scott puts on one hell of a show. Unfortunately, he also seems to have a strange habit of falling off stages and his latest topple may have cost Drake a small fortune. 
Drake and Young Thug thought it would be a great idea to bring out La Flame at the London stop of Drizzy’s Boy Meets World tour at the O2 arena on Wednesday, and though the crowd was thrilled, things went a little haywire. Unfamiliar with the arena, Travis apparently totally missed the gigantic hole in the middle of the stage . He walked right into it.

Again, the thing is gigantic. 


Like, a gaping hole — a chasm even — in the dead center of the stage. And Travis missed — or depending on your perspective hit — it completely. 
TRAVIS SCOTT FELL THROUGH THE HOLE IN THE MIDDLE OF DRAKE'S STAGE pic.twitter.com/CXraxZ0dao 
— Rodeo (@RodeoTheAlbum) February 1, 2017 

It looked funny, and Drake helped him out of the hole immediately and Travis kept right on performing his latest single “Goosebumps.” Except that fall apparently broke Drake’s giant, inflatable globe that serves as the centerpiece of his stage, and ruined his show. 

So Drake said he's refunding everyone their money for the technical fuck up. #shitgotreal #someonesgettingfiredtonight #papiainthappy pic.twitter.com/po06sqxR7e 
— Sable Seline (@SableSeline) February 1, 2017 

Drake announced several times throughout the concert that he’d set up refunds for everybody in attendance, and began calling it a free show, but he continued his set giving the fans the performance they came for to the best of his ability. 
He also confirmed it at the end. #BoyMeetsWorldTour pic.twitter.com/VHoyXrS0BZ 
— ♛ (@LAKE ) February 1, 2017 

Eventually he signed off by telling the crowd “London, England, I love you, I hope you enjoyed the free show,” before a mic drop and that was that. So those in attendance might want to send a courtesy thank you to Travis for all of their returned euros. As for Young Thug, well he took to Instagram to accept fault for the snafu, even though he didn’t really do anything but bring his buddy around.
